snippet: Congressional Democrats are increasingly expressing support for allowing Americans to retain the insurance coverage they are losing because of the Affordable Care Act.
abstract: Anxious congressional Democrats are threatening to abandon Pres Obama on a central element of his signature health care law; are voicing increasing support for proposals that would allow Americans who are losing their health insurance coverage because of Affordable Care Act to retain it; dissent comes as Obama administration released enrollment figures that fell far short of expectations, stoking criticism from Republicans.

byline.original: By ASHLEY PARKER and MICHAEL D. SHEAR
byline.contributor: Jonathan Weisman and Jeremy W. Peters contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Congressional Democrats are increasingly expressing support for allowing Americans to retain the insurance coverage they are losing because of the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: With Enrollment Slow, Some Democrats Back Change in Health Law
headline.print_headline:
With Enrollment Slow, Some Democrats Back Change in Health Law: A Push to Restore
Policies Being
Canceled

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
